content.description: On Kiddy Pool boulder to the left of Bobcat, sit start and climbs left side of roof up crimps to mantle topout.

Basically this is the left arete of the Life After Greenstone boulder. The first few moves are a little dabby (the rocks on the left are off) but continues up left arete of the boulder, sharing holds with Life After Greenstone but also using features up higher on the arete. Same topout as Life After Greenstone. Not a standout line but fun climbing nonetheless
SDS with a left hand on a okay sloper and right very wide on a good crimp. Left foot on a big old foothold. Move left hand to a poor crimp and right hand wide to a good gaston.
Starts at the end of Green Goblin. Reverses green goblin and climbs out through God's Own Greenstone.

A lot better than it looks and an extremely easy to protect problem for... wait for it... these unprecedented times. Start in crack jugs and move right along ledge with creative footwork. Gain slopers and top out right. Top out is most easily protected if you lean to the right.

 Make an argument for v4 if you want in the comments, but this is quite a bit easier than Greenstone Grease (that topout! I agree that one and Goober are both quite stiff for their numbers). There is probably a variation where you veer back left after gaining jugs instead of path of least resistance to the right, but top out will be much sketchier.
content.protection: 2 pads no spotter or one pad with spotter.
content.location: Crack and ledge system on far right of Greaser/Goober boulder in Greenstonia.

content.description: Sit start on sidepulls as Tabby Cat. Pull the first move and traverse left into Perfect Cat Son.
content.location: Left center of the overhung side of the Kiddy Pool Boulder.

content.description: Squat start matched on jug on left side of the Kiddy Pool Boulder. Move up to juggy seam and lock off up and left to a nice flake edge.

Low right start to "life after greenstone" move through edges and a cool pinch up into the plate edge in the middle below the crux to life after greenstone and finish that line and top out.  More fun start in my opinion.

SDS in the left corner of the large overhang that is somewhat up an arete. Move up the steepest part of the rock moving left at the top. SPOILERS: this was done in a kneepad. It probably isn't necessary, but that's the beta right now. This is in between the greenstone roof and greenstone grease.
content.protection: A LOT of pads. Needs at least 3 imo

content.description: Sit down start on a good jug. Either make a massive move (tall people) or use barely there intermediates to top out

Start on Greenstone Greaser; instead of topping out, traverse left on ledge features to gain Greenstone Goblin. In my opinion, this is the best (or least obnoxious route) on the boulder, as you avoid the Greaser topout and Goblin start, and the optimal traverse solution is pretty neat.Only downside is that even with leaving easy/safe sections unprotected, you pretty much need 3 pads solo: opening Greaser move, traverse crux, and bad landing of Goblin topout.
content.protection: 3 pads solo; probably could get away with 1 with spotter

content.description: Sit down start as the same for God's own greenstone, but at the side by side crimps start traversing right

Start the same as V5 Green Goober. First couple moves are the same. After reaching the left hand jug don't go straight up, instead traverse left to a good side pull. After the side pull there are a few small crimps and a good slot with blind feet. Continue left until reaching a sloppy knob and then top it out. If you've done Green Goober we thought it was a fun way to add a little difficulty.
Linkup of two great problems. Start on "Giant Green Goober" and traverse right into "Greenstone Greaser" to finish.
content.location: SDS on left side of Greenstone Grease Boulder on right facing crimp.

content.description: Sit down start on a large Jug/Crimp in the back of the save and move straight out of the cave via crimps until you hit some perfect jugs. Moving off the  crimps onto the jugs actually seems to be the crux. Taller climbers can do some foot magic but one of the first ascentionists ended up catching a massive swing. The top is not hard but actually pretty scray. We cleaned and practiced the top on a rope.
Sit down start matched on a crimps. I'll leave it at that... the beta for this one took a while
What looks like a little turd is actually some seriously solid stone with beautiful slopers. Only problem is it is extremely short
Climb the obvious off width/wide crack.few pads and a spotter. Not hiust long.
content.location: 50 feet in front of life after greenstone

content.description: Start the same as life after greenstone and do the first 4 moves. before going right hand out to the plate crimp halfway through the problem before the crux. move left out to a sloppy arette with the left hand. establish on the arette and look for the good edge back and left to rock over the top.
content.protection: Pads and spotter. Watch the boulder at your back.

content.description: Start on jug on right arete of the Kiddy Pool Boulder. Climb arete using large undercling and compression.

Basically below Life after Greenstone and to the right of the kiddie pool. Climbs a brown wall that is slightly overhanging, electric green lichen at ground level. Follow a faint seam feature from obvious starting holds into a slanty jug, then dyno up and right followed by a topout.
content.location: Basically in line with Life After Greenstone, but down the hill maybe 30 yards

content.description: Secluded bushwack accessible boulders with tons of potential for development. All the rock here is greenstone (as is most of the rest of the parkway). Plenty of opportunities for first ascents. Please check out blueridgebouldering.com/. No fires, camping, or leashless dogs.
